utterances.utterance: Almost two-thirds of our border is unsecured. You've got to see it to believe it. I'm Monica De La Cruz. Socialists are ruining our border security, our values, and our economy. You won't recognize America when they're done. In Congress, I'll end the catch-and-release, and always support our Border Patrol and law enforcement. I'm Monica De La Cruz, and I approve this message. And together we will finish what Trump started.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Texas Congressional candidate Monica De La Cruz joins me now. Monica, that's a pretty cool ad. But I thought immigration enforcement, we heard, was going to drive Hispanics out of the Republican Party. That is what the GOP establishment side for so many years.

utterances.speaker: MONICA DE LA CRUZ, (R) TEXAS CONGRESSIONAL CANDIDATE
utterances.utterance: Look, Hispanic values align with the Republican party. They are about faith, they are about family, and they are about freedom. Just the other day I was talking to a local citizen who is a Cuban-American, and he says we want the freedoms here in America. We fled socialist Cuba because we know socialism just does not work. And that's why Hispanics are moving towards the Republican Party.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: But on the border issue, obviously you are in the Rio Grande Valley. We've been in Del Rio reporting from they are a couple years ago actually when Trump was president. They didn't like any of this illegal immigration. They thought it was destroying border communities. Is that part of what you are appealing to as well?

utterances.speaker: DE LA CRUZ
utterances.utterance: You're absolutely right, Laura. Look, there are many people here who waited in line, sometimes for years, and paid their dues to come to America to live the American dream. So it's very frustrating. I have constituents here that have been in line, waiting patiently for five years to come in legally. And to see millions of people cross our border and get a free pass from the Biden administration is very upsetting to the people of Texas 15, but to Hispanics who did immigrate legally.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: And what do you say to Hispanics who had small businesses that were shut down during COVID, oftentimes indiscriminately so with very little payback with health benefit as we are seeing now? They lost everything, even with the federal government help that came.

utterances.speaker: DE LA CRUZ
utterances.utterance: You're absolutely right. Look, COVID affected all of our small businesses. And we saw them closing not only because of COVID but a labor shortage. So can you imagine small already have a labor shortage, but yet you have millions of illegals that are coming through Texas 15, just walking through, getting government aid. Look, our small businesses have suffered through this border crisis, our Border Patrol agents are understaffed. They need assistance to help secure our borders. And they are just simply not getting the resources that they need to keep American communities safe.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: Monica, we're going to be watching your race really closely. We wish you the best of luck. I think we are going to see a lot more of you. Thank you so much. And up next, DHS Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas reveals where his priorities really are. Surprising Last Bite, next.

utterances.speaker: INGRAHAM
utterances.utterance: I have good news, it looks like the DHS secretary Alejandro Mayorkas finally getting serious about security at our most vulnerable entry points. Tomorrow he's going to go to L.A. where he is going to review security operations ahead of this weekend's Super Bowl. He's going to meet with local law enforcement and the NFL security team. We don't know if he's staying for the game. What a philosophy, though. Ignore the border, police the Super Bowl. Maybe it's a start. That's it for us tonight. Remember our Valentine's Day special for Freedom Matters gear all made in the USA on LauraIngraham.com. Everything red, and we've gotten so many comments about how cozy this hoodie and sweatshirt is, awesome. We've a lot of red gear. Obviously, the t-shirt, you all know that. All the other stuff, pink hat. Sam likes the pink hat, All 10 percent off for Valentine's Day. Everything this month, all profits in February go to the wonderful women at the shady Grove Pregnancy Center in Maryland, incredible people. That is it for us tonight. I'm Laura Ingraham. Remember, it's America now and forever. Greg Gutfeld is next. Maybe I'll send him one of these. END
